system.description:
This spell causes a body of water to lower to half its normal depth in an area up to 10,000 square feet (width and length).

Effects:

  • The spell affects the area for the entire duration (or until dispelled).
  • If cast on a flowing body of water (such as a river or ocean), the water remains lowered in that area, and surrounding water does not flow in until the spell ends.
  • Ships and boats in the affected area may become stuck.

At Spell Expiration:

  • The water rushes back in suddenly, causing a violent surge.
  • Affected ships suffer 1d12 + 20 (21-32) points of hull damage.
  • Creatures on deck must make a saving throw vs. spells or be swept overboard.

Uses:

  • Ford a river by temporarily reducing its depth.
  • Reveal hidden areas by lowering pools of water.
  • Strand ships by dropping the water level around them.
